page.title: 08Education in Cranbrook
page.content: Education plays an important part in the life of the people of Cranbrook. There has been a school in the town for over 400 years.Cranbrook school was founded in 1518 when John Blueberry donated his house as a school for the poor children.In tudor times the school became a grammar school. Today the school provides an education for both boys and girls aged 13-18+.Girls were first admitted in 1971.In 1970 the boys school Swattenden moved to Angley Road and joined with the girls school of Mary Sheaffe to become Angley High School.Angley provides a general education for pupils arriving at the age of 11 from surrounding primary schools including Sissinghurst .They leave at 16.Dulwich provides a preparatory education from 5-13.Angley has a thriving adult education centre.
